pros: Great place to work, good employer
cons: work overload, less help, and staff

pros: The best part of GBC is the people, especially the faculty, who are generous with their time and willingness to help. The students come from many different backgrounds, making the campus vibrant.
cons: Staff can be difficult to reach. I think they are spread very thin.

pros: If you like small campuses, this one is uber small.
cons: Faculty freaks out in a room full of diverse students, implicit bias kicks in with a vengeance, and accusations are made. Watch yourself if you are BIPOC. Adjunct faculty who teach well threaten the full-time faculty. They will undermine you. None of the departments work together. Lack of support between departments. Laziness is rampant. Professors teach with the same methods and materials they've used for decades. The actively work only in never evolving.
Every area competes against each other. No one works as a team.
Very hard to advance and poor salary

pros: It is a small College, so everyone knows everyone or where to get necessary information. The people that I work with are mostly friendly and detail oriented. You are trained in a variety of tasks and the work never gets boring.
cons: Unfortunately education isn't a field that people get rich from, but it is enjoyable work.

pros: Kind people, small school feel - Everyone knows one another and you are able to work with students and professors on a more personal one-on-one level.
cons: Very little opportunity to move from a part-time position to a full-time position. Yearly part-time hour limit is fixed, no matter how much workload increases

pros: Small campus which means lots of student engagement. The s hill is growing however.
cons: I'm on part time so I don't know what may go on as a full time employee
